1.name: Freaks
1.description: A circus' beautiful trapeze artist agrees to marry the leader of side-show performers, but his deformed friends discover she is only marrying him for his inheritance.

2.name: One Way Passage
2.description: A terminally ill woman and a debonair murderer facing execution meet and fall in love on a trans-Pacific crossing, each without knowing the other's secret.

3.name: Scarface: The Shame of the Nation
3.description: An ambitious and nearly insane violent gangster climbs the ladder of success in the mob, but his weaknesses prove to be his downfall.

4.name: The Most Dangerous Game
4.description: An insane hunter arranges for a ship to be wrecked on an island where he can indulge in some sort of hunting and killing of the passengers.

5.name: I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang
5.description: Wrongly convicted James Allen serves in the intolerable conditions of a southern chain gang, which later comes back to haunt him.

6.name: The Mummy
6.description: A resurrected Egyptian mummy stalks a beautiful woman he believes to be the reincarnation of his lover and bride.

7.name: Tarzan the Ape Man
7.description: A trader and his daughter set off in search of the fabled graveyard of the elephants in deepest Africa, only to encounter a wild man raised by apes.

8.name: A Farewell to Arms
8.description: An American ambulance driver and an English nurse fall in love in Italy during World War I.

9.name: Grand Hotel
9.description: A group of very different individuals staying at a luxurious hotel in Berlin deal with each of their respective dramas.

10.name: Vampyr
10.description: A drifter obsessed with the supernatural stumbles upon an inn where a severely ill adolescent girl is slowly becoming a vampire.

11.name: Island of Lost Souls
11.description: An obsessed scientist conducts profane experiments in evolution, eventually establishing himself as the self-styled demigod to a race of mutated, half-human abominations.

12.name: The Sign of the Cross
12.description: A Roman soldier becomes torn between his love for a Christian woman and his loyalty to Emperor Nero.

13.name: Shanghai Express
13.description: A woman rediscovers a former lover during a dangerous train ride to Shanghai.

14.name: The Old Dark House
14.description: Seeking shelter from a storm, five travelers are in for a bizarre and terrifying night when they stumble upon the Femm family estate.

15.name: White Zombie
15.description: A young man turns to a witch doctor to lure the woman he loves away from her fiancé, but instead turns her into a zombie slave.

16.name: Trouble in Paradise
16.description: A gentleman thief and a lady pickpocket join forces to con a beautiful perfume company owner. Romantic entanglements and jealousies confuse the scheme.

17.name: Red Dust
17.description: The owner of a rubber plantation becomes involved with the new wife of one of his employees.

18.name: Emma
18.description: After decades of raising the motherless Smith children, housekeeper Emma Thatcher is faced with resentment when she marries their father.

19.name: Blonde Venus
19.description: A cabaret singer takes up with a millionaire to pay for her gravely ill husband's operation.

20.name: Three on a Match
20.description: Although Vivian Revere is seemingly the most successful of a trio of reunited schoolmates, she throws it away by descending into a life of debauchery and drugs.

21.name: Rasputin and the Empress
21.description: A prince plots to kill the mad monk Rasputin for the good of the czar, the czarina and Russia.

22.name: Murders in the Rue Morgue
22.description: A mad scientist seeks to mingle human blood with that of an ape, and resorts to kidnapping women for his experiments.

23.name: Horse Feathers
23.description: Quincy Adams Wagstaff, the new president of Huxley University, accidentally hires bumblers Baravelli and Pinky to help his school win the big football game against the rival Darwin University.

24.name: Le sang d'un poète
24.description: A young artist draws a face at a canvas on his easel. Suddenly the mouth on the drawing comes into life and starts talking. The artist tries to wipe it away with his hand, but when he looks...                See full summary »

25.name: What Price Hollywood?
25.description: The career of a waitress takes off when she meets an amiable drunken Hollywood director.

26.name: The Mask of Fu Manchu
26.description: Englishmen race to find the tomb of Genghis Khan before the sinister Fu Manchu does.

27.name: One Hour with You
27.description: An unhappily married couple try to come between a happy one.

28.name: Doctor X
28.description: A wisecracking New York reporter intrudes on a research scientist's quest to unmask The Moon Killer.

29.name: Hell's House
29.description: Jimmy idolizes bootlegger Matt, and when he refuses to implicate his friend, he is sent to reform school. He befriends Shorty, a boy with a heart condition, and escapes to let the world know about the brutal conditions.

30.name: Rain
30.description: A prostitute newly arrived in the South Pacific finds herself at odds with a stern missionary determined to save her soul.

31.name: Number Seventeen
31.description: A gang of thieves gather at a safe house following a robbery, but a detective is on their trail.

32.name: Little Orphan Annie
32.description: Daddy Warbucks has to go on a long trip, leaving Annie alone. While wandering the street, Sandy leads Annie to discover Mickey, who is crying. Mickey's grandmother recently died, and he is ...                See full summary »

33.name: No Man of Her Own
33.description: A con man on the run from the police falls for a librarian.

34.name: Boudu sauvé des eaux
34.description: A bookseller saves a tramp from drowning and shelters him, but the tramp's odd behavior starts to wear everyone down.

35.name: If I Had a Million
35.description: A dying tycoon gives million-dollar windfalls to eight people picked from the city directory.

36.name: The Bitter Tea of General Yen
36.description: A Chinese warlord and an engaged Christian missionary fall in love.

37.name: Red-Headed Woman
37.description: Lillian relentlessly attempts to seduce a married man.

38.name: The Wet Parade
38.description: The evils of alcohol before and during prohibition become evident as we see its effects on the rich Chilcote family.

39.name: The Phantom of Crestwood
39.description: Jenny Wren coerces banker Priam Andes to have a dinner party at his shorefront estate Crestwood, and instructs him to invite three other men, each of whom she plans to extort money from. ...                See full summary »

40.name: The Beast of the City
40.description: Police Chief Jim Fitzpatrick ruthlessly goes after organized crime and is prepared to use brutal and violent methods to fight it.

41.name: Love Me Tonight
41.description: A Parisian tailor finds himself posing as a baron in order to collect a sizeable bill from an aristocrat, only to fall in love with an aloof young princess.

42.name: Das blaue Licht - Eine Berglegende aus den Dolomiten
42.description: When the moon is full, young men die attempting to reach the mysterious blue light in the mountains.

43.name: Jewel Robbery
43.description: A gentleman thief charms a Viennese baron's wife and also conducts a daring daylight robbery of a jewellers.

44.name: Broken Lullaby
44.description: French soldier travels to Germany to find a family of a man he killed during World War I.

45.name: Otona no miru ehon - Umarete wa mita keredo
45.description: Two young brothers throw a tantrum when they discover that their father isn't the most important man in his workplace.

46.name: American Madness
46.description: Socially-conscious banker Thomas Dickson faces a crisis when his protégé is wrongly accused for robbing the bank, gossip of the robbery starts a bank run, and evidence suggests Dickson's wife had an affair...all in the same day.

47.name: Sinners in the Sun
47.description: A New York fashion model finds herself being pursued by a poor but honest garage mechanic and a rich philanderer.

48.name: Million Dollar Legs
48.description: A small country on the verge of bankruptcy is persuaded to enter the 1932 Los Angeles Olympics as a means of raising money. Either a masterpiece of absurdity or a triumph of satire, ...                See full summary »

49.name: The Purchase Price
49.description: A torch singer becomes a mail-order bride for a farmer.

50.name: This Is the Night
50.description: An affair is almost exposed when Claire's husband unexpectedly returns early from Summer Olympics.
